me.desht.sensibletoolbox.api

Interface STBInventoryHolder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    InventoryHolder
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    EnderStorageHolder
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractIOMachine, AbstractProcessingMachine, AutoBuilder, BaseSTBMachine, BasicSolarCell, BatteryBox, BigStorageUnit, DenseSolar, EnderBox, FiftyKBatteryBox, Generator, HeatEngine, HyperStorageUnit, ItemRouter, Masher, Pump, Sawmill, Smelter, TenKBatteryBox, TrashCan

    public interface STBInventoryHolder
extends InventoryHolder
    Represents an STB block which can hold an inventory of items.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ItemStack extractItems(BlockFace face, ItemStack receiver, int amount, UUID uuid)
      Attempt to extract items from the block on the given side.

      Attempt to actually insert an item into the block on the given side.
      Inventory showOutputItems(UUID uuid)
      Get a view of the items which can be extracted from this inventory holder.

      Update (overwrite) the STB output inventory slots with the contents of the supplied inventory.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.bukkit.inventory.InventoryHolder

        getInventory

    • Method Detail

      • insertItems

        int insertItems(ItemStack item,
              BlockFace face,
              boolean sorting,
              UUID uuid)
        Attempt to actually insert an item into the block on the given side.

        If a non-null uuid is provided, an access rights check should be made.

        Parameters:
        item - the item stack to insert (an attempt will be made to insert all items)
        face - the side to insert into; BlockFace.SELF may be used if insertion is manual
        sorting - if true, only insert if inventory is empty or already contains the item
        uuid - ID of the player who is doing the extracting (may be null)
        Returns:
        the number of items actually inserted

      • extractItems

        ItemStack extractItems(BlockFace face,
                     ItemStack receiver,
                     int amount,
                     UUID uuid)
        Attempt to extract items from the block on the given side. The size of the returned item stack could be smaller than the requested amount.

        If a receiver is specified, items will be only be extracted if they will stack with the receiver, and only up to the receiver's natural maximum stack size.

        If a non-null uuid is provided, an access rights check should be made.

        Parameters:
        face - the side to extract from; BlockFace.SELF may be used if extraction is manual
        receiver - buffer to receive the items (may be null)
        amount - the number of items to request
        uuid - ID of the player who is doing the extracting (may be null)
        Returns:
        the item stack extracted, or null if no item was extracted

      • showOutputItems

        Inventory showOutputItems(UUID uuid)
        Get a view of the items which can be extracted from this inventory holder. Note that the returned inventory is a copied view, and modifying it will not change the inventory holder's actual contents (but see updateOutputItems(UUID, org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory))

        If the player does not have access to this holder, or the holder provides no output slots, then this method will return null.

        Parameters:
        uuid - UUID of the player trying to get the view
        Returns:
        an inventory containing a copy of the items which can be extracted, may be null

      • updateOutputItems

        void updateOutputItems(UUID uuid,
                     Inventory inventory)
        Update (overwrite) the STB output inventory slots with the contents of the supplied inventory.

        If the player does not have access to this holder, or the holder provides no output slots, then this method is a no-op.

        Parameters:
        uuid - UUID of the player trying to update the inventory
        inventory - the source inventory to update items from
